review:
Hyper Fighters ist ein Railshooter der Extraklasse. Aber allen voran ist es ein Spiel. Dazu später mehr.

Im Spiel fliegt man in einem Kampfflugzeug und muss sich gegen andere Flugzeuge und Schiffe behaupten. Man zielt mit der Maus über den ganzen Bildschirm und steuert so wohin man schießt. Auf der linken Maustaste befinden sich die Geschütze und auf der rechten Maustaste hat man 10 Raketen. Das Gameplay erinnert, abgesehen davon, dass man sich auch bewegen kann, extrem an Moorhuhn. Und der Bewegungsfaktor geht deswegen in die Brüche, weil er mit den Richtungstasten anstatt mit WASD erfolgt. Hab nur 10 mal gekotzt. 

Man hat 4 Leben und wenn man stirbt, dann respawnt man auf der Stelle neu. Verliert man alle Leben, dann geht man Game Over. Aber anstatt, dass man dann in dem Level weitermacht, in dem man gestorben ist, muss man das Level davor nochmal komplett neu spielen. Nur 20 mal gekotzt. 

Die Gegner sind ungefähr so angenehm wie ein Eiterpickel am Arsch. Vor allem wenn Bier und Raketen im Spiel sind. Der Bossgegner eines jeden Levels ist relativ schnell erreicht (ca. 5-8 Minuten) und während dieser zig Geschütze und anderes mit Lebensbalken hat, muss man anscheinend nur eine bestimmte Anzahl von Lebensbalken vernichten um den Sack übern Jordan zu schicken. Angenehm geht trotzdem anders.

Die Grafik ist jetzt nicht so neu (erinnert mich an Sniper Elite 1), der Soundtrack ist okay und der Voice Actor des Piloten scheint Sonic zu sein (und befeuert einen mit kecken Sprüchen wie  "theres moar wher dats comin fromm"). Das ist natürlich irgendwo ganz witzig, aber woanders auch ziemlich nervtötend. 
Spätestens nachdem ich realisierte, dass man nach einem Tod das Level davor nochmal komplett neu spielen muss, hab ich mich erhangen und das Spiel deinstalliert.

Müsst ihr wissen.

review:
I'm not sure I paid for this game. 
The fact is that I found it in my library, and I was interested in it because it was the second worst title in order of reviews, among all the ones I own. 
I installed it and tried it out to see if it was actually that bad. 
The game is an arcade created for the Wii platform, of which this appears to be a hasty port. 
The game runs very well (we must also take into account the release date) but many things have not been adapted.
The most annoying things at first startup are three:
-keyboard integration is incomplete (menus can't be scrolled with keys, and an on-screen keyboard is used when entering a profile name);
-the graphics settings cannot be changed from within the game. The most annoying thing that results is excessive motion blur and low resolution;
-the limited field of view can be irritating.
The good news is that the resolution can be partially changed via configuration files. The same goes for motion blur and other small options that can be turned on or off. 
You can probably change the key assignment as well. An interesting option that is listed is the FSAA, which if activated, probably because it is incompatible, unfortunately hides all three-dimensional models. 
When the resolution is changed, the menu interface and the HUD remain at the original resolution, while the models are rendered at the set resolution. 
This game has many problems, but the fun-price-problems ratio allows me to recommend the product if you find it for free.
I could see it being played on a cabin cruiser, where the problems wouldn't be as noticeable or even be problems at all ( e.g. the on-screen keyboard one). 

My final vote is 5.8/10

review:
Dieses Spiel erinnert mich ein bisschen an die alten Arcade-Shooter in den Spielehallen der 80er- und 90er-Jahre. Vor allem an Titel wie "House of the Dead", bei dem man lediglich eine Pistole als Controller hatte und damit auf Zombies zielte. Das Spiel lenkt das Flugzeug von alleine, minimale Bewegungskommandos sind möglich um Schüssen auszuweichen, ansonsten hat man nichts weiter zu tun als mit der Maus/ dem Controller auf die Feinde zu zielen und abzudrücken.

Für eine Spielehalle wäre das Spiel geeignet, für Zuhause ist es meiner Meinung nach zu schwach von der Story und vom ganzem Design. Es gibt deutlich bessere Spiele in denen man ein Flugzeug steuern kann,...und das sogar komplett!

review:
[i] Hyper Fighters[/i] – 3d shoot ‘em up. Обычно игры подобного жанра похожи на пережитки прошлого или телефонные проекты, Hyper Fighters же вполне самобытная PC игра. С самого начала нам предлагают выбрать самолёт:
[list]
[*]Лёгкий – мало проку, всё равно пространство для манёвров строго ограничено.
[*]Средний – самый лучший вариант, запас прочности приличный, манёвренность же не даст собрать все ракеты, летящие в вас.
[*]Тяж – неплохой вариант, однако против боссов будет не комфортно.
[/list]
С уровнями сложности уж распинаться не стану. Сюжета как такого нет.

Графика на уровне 2005 года, однако, если не выправить конфиг, то наслаждаться предстоит 2000 годом. Собственно, разработчики особо не парились с переносом игры с Wii. Звуки так себе, саундтрек беспокоит нас лишь в меню.

Перед нами самый обыкновенный тир, без каких-либо фишек, реализованный на более обновленный лад. Да, игра плохая и пустая, но срывать свою злость за обман сайтов по продаже ключей на какой-то мусорной игре – моветон.

review:
よくあるアーケード方式のレールシューターゲーム

強制フルスクリーン
音量弄る以外にオプションは無い
操作説明無しで突然戦場に放り出される
実際のところ操作は矢印キー[b]"だけ"[/b]対応でWASDで動けない
マウスで狙って撃つゲームなんだけど、一定確率か敵殺した数だかでAutoFireが表示されてマウス押さなくても撃てる
だったら最初からずっとオートファイアさせろや
などと思ったが矢印キーとマウスクリックしかやる事ないゲームでオートファイア発動したら機体動かす以外やる事ないからあっても無くてもクソじゃない？
あと敵の攻撃は避けないと秒で溶けて死ぬが
避け方は弾が来たら避けるとか打ち落とすじゃなくて右下右上左上左下…と
四角形をイメージするように四方画面を順番に動いてるだけでほぼほぼ全部避けれる
ただそれでも物量にかまけて恐ろしい量で敵が弾をぶっ放してくるから何れにせよ一定のダメージは絶対に避けられない
苦労して矢印キーを一定のリズムで頑張って操作してるってのに絶対は避けれないってどういうことだってばよ
やってみると分かるけど（やらなくていいけど）このゲーム、矢印キーを押しっぱじゃなくて交互に押すせいで妙に指が疲れるんだわマジで
ここまで頑張ったあげく残機無くなったら最初からやり直しって割に合わんぞ
それから自機がクソデカすぎて敵が見えづらい
あげく自機の後ろ画面外から突っ込んできて敵が出て来る感じなんだけど
その時にたいていのゲームは避けようがないから敵の衝突時だけ無敵とかノーダメージ判定になるもんだけど
このゲームはクソデカ自機にキレイにかぶさるように後ろから突っ込んでくるのにダメージ判定あるせいでこれもまたダメージ避けづらい
ゲーム内（精神的）にせよプレイヤーの指に対する負荷（物理的）にせよ
どっからどこまでもプレイヤーを徹底的に痛めつけようとしてくる恐ろしいゲーム

端的に言ってクソ
絶対にやるなよ

author: {'steamid': '76561197996495980', 'num_games_owned': 5289, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1514194217}
review:
That's right, this is a thumbs up.  Now I'm not recommending that anyone actually [b]pay money[/b] for this game.  That would be a very silly thing to do.  But if you are among the thousands who already own the game from a bundle or a giveaway, I do recommend that you give it a shot.  It can be fun, as long as you are aware of the following:

- This isn't a flight sim, it's a rail shooter.  There is no freedom of movement, other than dodging enemy planes & projectiles
- You use arrow keys to dodge, the mouse to shoot, B to replenish missiles (usually not available), and R in conjunction with the arrow keys to barrel roll.  Yes, you have to use your third hand for this last one.
- Don't lead enemies with your fire.  It doesn't work.  Only shoot when the reticle is on top of them, and the shots will magically hit.
- The graphics are at most servicable.  You can edit autoexec.lua in the install directory to change the resolution from the default 1280x720, but that doesn't improve things much.  
- The times that the "powerups" are granted make no sense.  You can get autofire in between enemy waves, armor repair seconds into a level, 7 levels in a row with no extra lives and then suddenly 3 in one level.
- Once you lose all your lives, it's Game Over, start over from level 1.
- Unless playing on Easy (which I didn't try), choose the "middle" plane.  The heavy one is a sitting duck that blocks your vision as much as it blocks enemy fire.  The light one dies if a boss as much as looks at it.
- A not insignificant amount of damage you take will be from enemies colliding with you from behind.  This includes helicopters that somehow overtake your state of the art jet fighter while moving backwards.  To minimize the occurance of this, try not to spend a lot of time at the top of the available dodge area.

So, um, yeah, that's all that's needed to somehow enjoy the game.  At least it was enough for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991034009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1514079796}
review:
Don't bother with this, not even for a buck. I got this in bundle like ages ago and even then I feel ripped off.

So, the game is a rail shooter and looks outdated as all hell. I knew that going in and was okay with it. And then you actually play it. First of all there is no manual, no control settings, nothing. It's not just that you can't rebind the keys, you can't even look them up in game. I had to check a guide to know the basic controls, because they are not intuitive at all. So you aim with the mouse, shoot with the lef mouse button, aim rockets with the right one and use the booster with the middle (wheel). Okay, so far so good. You have limited control over the plane with the cursor keys (no, not WASD and no, you cannot rebind them), which is necessary to be able to dodge some and keep enemies in focus. However, there's also B and R. B buys rockets (one by one until you hit an unspecified limit where you can't get more) and R does a barrel roll (you can't do that with the heavy plane), which essential for survival. Except, you have your right hand on the mouse, your left on the cursor keys, so good luck actually reaching R and B without getting killed.

If you manage to stomach the controls, the game still has more issues for you to cope with. The graphics are not just shit, they are low res (800 x 600) and forced to fullscreen. Oh, and all the water you see on the official screenshots? It's not actually there. As in the water texture is literally missing, so every ship looks like as if they were floating in air. Considering that out of the first 10 missions 9 plays over some body of water, this is quite a major garphical issue. 

As for the actual gameplay, the normal enemies are the same throughout the game and kinda boring. They are dangerous only because the rail you are locked on makes no sense, especially on the later stages. Your plane moves erratically, hardly ever keeping the actual enemy planes in sight for more than a couple of seconds. Occasionally enemies come from behind you, crashing into you (taking away health) or you get shot by rockets from impossible to dodge angles because of this and there's not much you can do against that. Now, if you do combos (as in kill a lot of enemies in a row) you get bonuses: 4-5 gets you laser sight (useless), about 7-8 resets the overheat on your main gun, 9-11 sets in autofire (kinda useless, though autofire doesn't overheat your weapon for some reason), about 13 gives you a pack of rockets and I think about 15 gives you a life. This would be cool, if it wasn't literally impossible to reach the higher combos on most levels. See, the game ususally throws groups of 3-5 at you, very ocdcasionally 2 groups of 3-5 from different angels. Once you shoot these down, there's a 2-3 seconds break before the next group. This break is not enough for the weapon overheat to reset, but more than enough for your combo counter to reset. And, no, you cannot wait for the next group to show up before you shoot down the first one, because then the first group is likely to spam the screen full of rockets, costing you a lot of health.

The bosses look kinda cool (the only graphically acceptable part of the game really), but essentially all of them work the same way: they are big, tanky and essentially stationary with your plane flying in a predefined loop around them. Now bosses have gun placements that you can serparately take out to disarm them, except hitting the turrets do little to no damage to the boss itself and each turret has like a third of the health of the boss. And every boss have like 6-10 turrets. In other words, it's suicide to go for the tuurrets, just unload on the main body of the boss. The bosses will inevitably kill you, as the rail is just stupid. Like the stage 10 boss have a whole array of forward facing lasers that cannot shoot sideways or backwards. So if you were to control the plane, you would probably approach from the sides or from behind where the boss is only light defended with a couple of machine guns, right? How is the rail set up? 2/3 of it is a full frontal attack with no space to dodge or cover to hide behind. I did my best to move around, had the booster on all the time and still lost my last two lives there. Oh, and mind youm this was on easy. I seriously don't think the game is actually beatable on hard, and very doubtful about medium.

Oh, that reminds me: the game has no save system. If you run out of health, you get a new plane immediately. If you run out of lives, you will have to restart the game from the beginning. And since the game is VERY unfair with nonsensical rails to shoot from, you will die a lot even on easy.

So, yeah, this game isn't just overly simplistic and bad looking, but downright horrible to actually play.

Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: This is basically a game that would had ran well in an arcade rail shooting cabinet. It is buggy and does not detect win and failure states correctly and seems to have been simply rigged to not require coins.

This looks and feels a lot like one of yersteryear's coin operated arcade rail shooter. The kind where you would have this gigantic prop gun, and maybe some pedals, and guzzle coins like crazy. You would do it because the technology was screaming edge at the time, and it was nice to enjoy the engrossing visuals, even if the mechanics of the game were barebones, it was kind of like a tech demo, but one where you had this cool prop to operate, sometimes the prop would vibrate, or you had to push something to reload. This game has an overheating gun mechanic, the cracks in the windshield health bar... the whole package... Anyways, as it stands its a relic of a times past, maybe I am incorrect and this comes from a shovelware developper or some console I never heard of... either way it its slow, the odds are kind of impossible, but even when I died the game allowed me to progress anyway, I guess as a consequence of not having any coins to insert... 

I died at a boss and the game just finished off the boss for me even though it was full health, and send me on to the next mission

author: {'steamid': '76561198113175272', 'num_games_owned': 1074, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1486914988}
review:
发行日期：2011年6月14日
Steam上架时间：2014年1月23日

本来还以为这游戏叫做“炒鸡战士”，查了一下才知道Fighter还有战斗机的意思，感谢这个游戏让我多学了一个单词！
一进入游戏，看到画面非常扁，第一反应就是调一调分辨率了。打开设置，惊了，发现只有三个选项——音乐、音效、颠倒（上下控制），偏偏没有分辨率的设置。可能有的游戏要进入战斗才有设置调，那就先进去吧。选了简单（猛男是这样的）难度进入游戏。发现还是没有，算了开打吧。诶，我都不知道怎么控制怎么打呀，把键盘按了个遍，终于知道了方向键就是上下左右。但是！怎么射击啊，看了一眼右边的鼠标，不会是你吧。哇，还真是。我的天，左键机枪，右键飞弹。这游戏一定是左撇子设计的，充满了对惯用手是右手的深深恶意。打着打着发现飞弹用完了，显示buy rocket！这游戏还能买飞弹？但是根本没时间去找啊，连教学都没有的游戏至少要给一个控制说明吧。有时候打着打着飞弹又有了，这还不是和命绑定的，突然就出现了。游戏视角和射击的控制多适应一下就会稍微习惯，没错是稍微！战斗机血量比较低时机体会有火光和冒烟，本来就不容易看到的敌人这下更难发现了，这不是把人往死路上逼吗？BOSS战实在太单调，战斗机会自动绕着BOSS飞，基本打法都一样，用飞弹攻击非常有效，可以省很大劲儿。对了，机枪有温度的设定，过热就要冷却一会儿，所以得把握好射击的时机。第一次玩止步于第7关，并不想再玩一遍。以上算是给准备玩这个游戏的盆友的建议吧，应该不会有人去买吧，看完我的评测估计也不会去买了吧。

review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
3д тир в котором мы будучи пилотом реактивного истребителя уничтожаем вражеские самолеты, корабли, наземную пехоту и громадных боссов. Мы можем стрелять из пулемета, стрелять ракетами и перемещаться по экрану в пределах пары метров.

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
¥ Динамичный геймплей. Наш самолет - аналог Рэмбо в мире самолетов.

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
¥ Нет никаких графических настроек (по умолчанию графика ужасна и отличается от скриншотов).
¥ Нельзя поменять управление (на стрелочках не очень удобно).
¥ Унылый звук и саундтрек.
¥ Нет достижений.
¥ Если потеряли все жизни, то нужно начинать игру сначала.
¥ Очень мало типов противников и по сути уникальные только боссы в конце уровня.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
Если бы после смерти не пришлось проходить игру заново, а можно было бы продолжать с последнего уровня, я бы поставил положительную оценку, а так по сути одноразовую игру заставляют проходить до упора пока не получится переигрывая в случае небольшой криворукости. Это и оттолкнуло. Нейтральная оценка рассматривалась уже с первых минут игры, а палец вниз опустил лишь данный минус.

[h1]Оценка: 5/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

review:
An on rails shooter in the vein of the old Star Fox or Panzer Dragoon games, but not nearly as good. There's a severe lack of feedback on anything you do in this game; your bullets don't actually make contact with enemies so much as your reticule damages them. You get extra lives, extra rockets, and gun overheating cool down powerups through out the levels at set points, but without any sort of warning, consistency or purpose. Should you use up all your rockets now? Overheat your gun for this wave of enemies? Maybe. Dodging enemy fire is a similarly mysterious affair of flying in a hopefully evasive square pattern. 

On the other hand the gameplay is nostalgically evocative of older, better titles. The boss designs are pretty neat, though ultimately wasted on the game mechanics available. There is a framework for a classic arcade shooter here provided someone took the time to realize it. If you got this for pennies in some bundle, I can't wholeheartedly recommend neglecting it if you have any sort of fondness for the games it's poorly trying to emulate. Worth ten to twenty minutes of your time, but not much more.

review: Поиграв несколько минут стало интересно, кто же сделала сей "шедевр". Как оказалось, то были создатели FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction, Team 6 Studios за свою карьеру не сделали ничего добротного ... с того всплывает вопрос: На кой черт они делают игры ? review:
A première vu, Hyper Fighter est vite décevant lorsqu'on l'a entre les mains. La 3D est intéressante, surtout pour du shoot-them-up, et la musique est vraiment pas mal. Le jeu est maniable, en ce sens que le vaisseau réponds positivement aux touches du clavier et ne tente pas de se fracasser contre tous les murs invisibles autour. Cependant, sans aucune indication des touches, le reste est quelque peu compliqué : l'auto-fire s'activait de manière impromptue, sans que je comprenne pourquoi, j'ai activé le laser-sight sans pouvoir le désactiver par la suite, et  j'ai passé plus de temps à pianoter sur mon clavier pour acheter de nouvelles roquettes qu'en écrivant cette évaluation. Le jeu n'offre pas de grand moment de fun, bien loin de là, et semble assez vide une fois la première minute passé. Autant dire que le peu de temps sur ce jeu a été assez douloureux pour me couper l'envie d'y retourner.

Note : 1 / 10
Les plus : bons graphismes, bonne musique et bonne maniabilité
Les moins : aucune indication de touche, peu attractif au final et franchement vide.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995905380', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1451451252}
review:
Not much else to say other than it is a shoddily made console port of a rail shooter.

Fixed resolution, only options available are audio volume and vertical axis inversion. The game doesn't feature any sort of controller support or even configurable key bindings - which this game sorely needs as the default control mapping is hideous at best. Not only the game only accepts movement through arrow keys, there's a barrel roll key as well. Guess what it's bound to?

[h1][b]R.[/b][/h1]

No. seriously. Whoever thought this was a good idea needs to be shot in the face.

Boss fights basically resume to spam all your rockets at the boss, die, and finish it off. Normal waves involve shooting at patterns of one-shottable aircraft, combined with eventual ships requiring several seconds of fire to take out, submarines that manage to shoot several missiles at you before you can destroy them, and difficult-to-spot SAM sites. Later levels also include helicopters(mostly a nuisance) andd attack craft(which come in groups of at least 3, with each one firing several high-damage missiles at once). 

You also get powerups for no apparent reason. These powreups also seem random at best, such as resetting weapon cooldown despite the weapon overheat gauge being at 0, shooting weapons automatically even though there are no enemies on screen, or refilling your rockets even though you had all rockets you could carry already.

The most infuriating part of the game is enemies you can't aim at still damage you, courtesy of a fixed camera system. Bullets shot at you are occasionally dodgeable, but appear to be hitscan most of the time.

The game is also surprisingly short. I've completed it in roughly an hour of gameplay. Story is lackluster and almost completely nonsense at times, voice acting ignores the situation completely, and the soundtrack is repetitive.

The only interesting mechanic in the game is drag-based missile lock-on - you can fire multiple missiles(which ingame are named as rockets) at multiple targets by dragging the mouse cursor at the targets you want to hit and releasing it to fire the missile salvo. The mechanic, however, is underutilized because of the gameplay's blandness.

review:
Wygląd gry jest mylący, myślałam że odpalam jakiś symulator śmigłowca :D Po 40 minutach gry jestem w stanie powiedzieć jedno - już zapomniałam jak śmiesznie grało się w celowniczki :D W pełnokrwistym celowniczku nie masz wpływu na ruch bohatera, jedyne co możesz zrobic to namierzać cel i pilnować żeby spluwa się nie przegrzała lub ładować amunicję. W Hyper Fighters możemy teoretycznie robić uniki - trudno mi powiedzieć jak to działa, gdyż zdecydowałam się na mało zwrotny bombowiec, którym torpedy można co najwyżej zestrzelić. 
Jeżeli szukasz gry akcji, to nie ten adres. To raczej zabawa dla miłośników staroci takich jak Rebel Assault czy Time Crisis. Zwłaszcza że choć gra jest sprzed kilku lat, wygląda jak tytuł na PS2. Plansze są raczej nudne w wystroju, ale bossowie są całkiem fajnie zaprojektowani w steampunkowym stylu.
Przydałoby się wprowadzić ruch samolotu na WSAD zamiast strzałek.

review: Was in aller Welt ist DAS???!!! Das Spiel ist 2011 erschienen (laut Veröffentlichungsdatum auf Steam) und sieht aus wie ein Spiel für PS2. Wo wir bei Steuerung sind: Wer hat denn im Jahr 2011 die Idee gehabt die Steuerung des Flugzeuges auf Die Pfeiltasten zu setzen? Wenn man das wenigstens ändern könnte....aber NEIN. Ich habs zum Glück kostenlos bekommen (Indiegala) aber wer auch immer sich das kauft oder gekauft hat tut mir sehr, sehr leid. NICHT! Wer so doof ist und für so einen Rotz 9€ ausgibt ist selber schuld! Ach ja: Das Game ist vom Entwickler Team 6 Studios und Funbox Media ltd, welche unter anderem Spiele wie zum Beispiel Flatout 3 und Glacier 3: Meltdown entwickelt haben. Und wer diese beiden Spiele kennt weiß, dass diese Spiele für Qualität stehen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198209090689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1444829635}
review: Dotychczas byłam zdania, że poza bardzo amatorskimi grami przeglądarkowymi praktycznie nie ma gier tak słabych aby granie w nie nie zapewniało chociaż odrobiny rozrywki. Po zagraniu w Hyper Fighters uświadomiłam sobie jak bardzo się myliłam. Nie oczekiwałam zbyt wiele od tej gry. Spodziewałam się prostej gierki 3D bez rozbudowanej fabuły w której można sobie polatać i postrzelać do samolotów, statków i celów naziemnych. Nie przepadam za symulatorami i spodziewałam się raczej sterowania w stylu arcade. Niestety, strasznie się zawiodłam a to głównie z tego powodu, że w praktyce pod względem sterowania jest to gra 2D. Samolot sam leci po ustalonej trasie, sam skręca, nie można nim przyspieszyć ani zwolnić, nie jest możliwy lot pionowo w górę, nurkowanie czy zawrócenie maszyny. Można jedynie wykonywać proste uniki i strzelać do nadlatujących przeciwników którzy padają po pojedynczym trafieniu. Czasem pojawiają się także jakieś okręty które można zniszczyć rakietą, sporadycznie jakieś cele na ziemi oraz boss pod koniec każdej misji na którego trzeba poświęcić nieco więcej czasu, ale tak naprawdę niewiele to zmienia. Nie można zrzucać bomb a jedynie strzelać z działka o nieskończonej amunicji i korzystać z ograniczonej liczby rakiet. To jest coś w stylu Galaga z NES tylko, że znacznie łatwiejsze do przejścia (co prawda ja ukończyłam jedynie dwa poziomy zanim gra totalnie mnie znudziła, ale wątpię, aby na późniejszym etapie było znacznie lepiej). Są na PC fajne strzelanki 2D, ale ta zdecydowanie się do nich nie zalicza. Jeśli mam być szczera to widziałam już lepsze darmowe gry przeglądarkowe. Grafika nie byłaby taka zła gdyby nie modele samolotów, które są po prostu nijakie (to chyba wina rozmytych tekstur). Nie sugerujcie się screenami na Steamie - wyglądają na podrasowane albo przynajmniej specjalnie wyselekcjonowane. Opcji w ustawieniach jest tyle co kot napłakał. Można zmienić tylko głośność efektów dźwiękowych, muzyki i odwrócić sterowanie. Żadnych opcji graficznych tam nie znajdziecie podobnie jak przypisania klawiszy. Nie ma nawet podanej klawiszologii. Cena (aktualnie 8,99 Euro) to totalne nieporozumienie biorąc pod uwagę, że taki Air Conflicts: Secret Wars jest zaledwie o 1 Euro droższy a często wychodzi taniej ze względu na liczne przeceny. Ja zgarnęłam tę grę za darmo, ale i tak żałuję czasu który na nią poświęciłam. Jest sporo gier (w tym lotniczych) nawet sprzed kilkunastu lat które prezentują się znacznie lepiej. Może coś takiego sprawdziłoby się na tabletach albo smartfonach, ale zdecydowanie nie na PC.

review:
Весьма припоганого качества линейный тир.

1) Геймплей: игра проходится за полтора часа от силы. В начале мы выбираем из 3 самолетов: больше брони, больше урона, али сбалансированный вариант. Наш самолет летит по запрограммированному маршруту, единственное что мы можем делать, это нацелевать прицел на врагов и сбивать их, изредкая запуская ракеты. Если сбивать вражин цепочками, можно получить бонусы в виде дополнительных ракет, или охлаждение пушки. Враги на всех уровнях одни и те же - зенитки, пару моделей самолетов, вертолет, корабль, и подлодка. Несколько отличаются локации.  Даже на высоком уровне сложности игра довольно легка. В конце каждого уровня наш ждет босс, ждет чтобы получить 4-5 ракет, и быть сбитым за пару секунд, боссы в этой игре это апофеоз унылости, сложности они не представляют, если сберечь ракеты (а тратить на рядовых врагов их смысла нет, разве только на корабли). В целом это линейный тир как он есть в своем наихудшем варианте.

2) Графика: она в игре такая же унылая как геймплей. Зайдя в игру, меня охватила ностальгия, ибо картинка чем-то напоминала симуляторы на втором плейстейшене (хотя там они были реализованы в основной массе лучше и красивше). Хоть игра и вышла в 2011, но картинка здесь максимум тянет на середину 2000-х. При всем при этом настройки графики в игре поменять нельзя вообще.

3) Звуки: в игре однообразная музыка, и имхо не очень приятная на слух озвучка.

Стоит иметь ввиду что эту игру разрабатывала команда Team 6, которая славится тем что делает по 2-3 трэшевых гоночных (именно гоночных) симулятора в год. Можете посмотреть серию Glacier, для наглядности. Эти разрабы не умеют делать нормальные игры. Так что данный рельсовый шутер, я советую обойти стороной, и купить себя игру получше.

2 истребителя из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017200784', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1441724353}
review:
Poor arcade port.

Hyper Fighters is 3d "on the rails" shooter developed by team 6 studios originally on the Wii and ported to PC. As an on the rails type game you have limited control of your jet as you focus on shooting down enemies coming at you. There isn't much of story, but you play as fighter pilot whose task is to save the world from villains accross the world.


Positive
- 14 levels - Each levels leaves you facing waves of foes and in most levels there is a boss.
- 3 planes - each plane has different stats in three areas: armor,firepower and manouvarability. Planes also carry different amounts of rockets.
- 3 difficulty settings - Easy, medium and hard.
- Replayability - You can replay levels you won previously with the ability to choose a new plane or new difficulty setting.
- Extra lives - You unlock extra lives while playing which allows you to respwan right after death.
- Boosts/upgrade - You earn random boosts (i.e invincibility, auto shooting, laser targetting) during game play.


Negative
- No control customisation - There are no options to customise controls, so your stuck with using arrow keys to move and 
- Poor graphics - The environment looks bad with low detailed textures. Aircraft textures and models don't fair much better either.
- No option to change resolution 
- Short - Completed it in an hour (on easy)
- Repetition - Most of the mission will require you to go through waves of foes before meeting up with the boss aircraft. There are only 2-3 missions where there are no bosses and just simply waves of foes.
- No upgrade/boost indicators - when you recieve an upgrade, a word quickly flashes on the screen which tells you what you got. the problem is that the words are too small and appear breifly. Another issue is that you don't now how long the upgrade lasts for as there is no timer or bar to show you.
- Poor Audio - Weapon effects don't sound good (passable at best). Background music sometimes appears during level;s but they aren't good either. There is very limited voice acting with the pilot (I think?) saying something forgettable before level, plus before and after a boss fight.
- Limited weapons - You only have machine guns and limited rockets, thats it...
- Limited planes and no customisation - You can't customise or upgrade your plane at all, you can only choose bewteen 3 planes.
- Limited choice - Once you choose your plane you have to continue playing with it in the next level.
- Limited foe variety - You face Jets, helicopters, battleships, submarines and giant ships (which serve as bossses). Sounds like alot, but you will see them again and again.


Overall, I suggest you pass on this and look for a better game.

review:
Sería un buen juego si:

1.- Si fuera más rápido y ágil. El avión va a la velocidad del tocino. Además de ser absurdo visualmente ver un árbol pasando por debajo de ti a la misma velocidad a la que irías caminando, quita toda la espectacularidad y frenetismo que tanto necesitan estos arcade.

2.- Si tuviera un menú donde poder ver y definir los controles. No se puede configurar NADA en este juego; la resolución es fija, los controles son fijos (y desconocidos en las primeras partidas) y tan sólo podremos ajustar el sonido. Esto es vagancia y lo demás son tonterías.

3.- Si se pudiera guardar. Vale que hayan querido darle un toque de recreativa arcade rollo "After Burner", donde te los tenías que ventilar con cinco duros, pero a veces no tengo dos horas y pico para pasarme el juego del tirón. Ni GANAS.

4.- Si las explosiones no fueran fuegos artificiales para hacer bonito. Cuando destruyes a los jefes salen una de llamas y de explosiones que lo puedes flipar, pero cuando se disipan vemos la nave tal-y-como-estaba-antes. Cutre a morir.

5.- Que te impacten misiles que no están en tu radio de visión, sobre todo contra los jefes. Te pelan el culo cuando les das la popa que DA GUSTO.

Se le pueden criticar muchas más cosas, pero mejorando lo dicho hubiera sido un aceptable "shooter on rails".

Si lo pudiste conseguir gratis (de no ser así no lo compres, no querrás recompensar la vagancia de cuatro holgazanes ¿verdad?, ¿VERDAD?) merece la pena echarle una o dos partidas por lo siguiente:

-Tiene una música aceptable
-La propuesta, aunque mal ejecutada, entretiene un rato
-Tiene ese espíritu de máquina recreativa que tiene su qué.

Es una pena que no se haya pulido más, podría haber sido un buen juego. Ya que te pones a hacer un port de Wii a PC, pónle ganas, narices.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992809773', 'num_games_owned': 5836, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1441276732}
review:
[h1] 概要[/h1]
いわゆる海外では"rail shooter"と呼ばれるジャンルの3Dアクションシューティングゲームです。
[u]フライトシミュレータではありません [/u]のでお気をつけてください。
ゲームシステムとしては、コースが最初から決まっていて、その範囲内で機体を操作し、敵を撃って倒す3Dシューティングです。雰囲気は往年の傑作アーケードゲーム「アフターバーナー」あたりをイメージしていただけると近いかもしれませんが、残念ながらこのゲームはその足元にもおよびませんが……

レビューでは酷評されていますが、[u]いくつかの大きな問題点[/u]（後述）に目をつむれば結構遊べるゲームです。ノリの良いBGMをバックに、最新鋭ジェット戦闘機で大空を舞い、敵機をバッタバッタ打ち落しまくる爽快感のあるシューティングゲームです。頭を使わない息抜き用ゲームとしては、結構おすすめです。
全14ステージで、ほとんどのステージでは最後に巨大ボスが待ち受けています。各ステージは地域、時間帯、天候など変化に富んでいるので、単調さはあまり感じないと思いません。
さすがに定価ではおすすめできませんが、時々セールで大幅割引をしているので、そうした時ならばとして購入してもいいかもしれません。

[h1] 問題点[/h1]
・操作キーの設定が変更できず、コントローラなども使用できません
基本操作はカーソルキーとマウスです。一般的なWASDのキーで操作したくても変更はできません。左手でカーソルキー、右手でマウスという非常に窮屈な操作を強いられます。キーボードを目一杯左に寄せてプレイしましょう。もしかしたら、開発者は全員、左手でマウスを操作する人たちなのかもしれません。
1つだけ変更できる項目があります。カーソルキー上下の入れ替えです。これがあるだけでも個人的には救いです。

・画面の解像度が変更できません
解像度は固定でフルスクリーン強制です。画質などの設定変更もできません。ただし、ゲーム自体は現代のPCでは軽い部類なので、設定を下げる必要は少ないので我慢しましょう。

[h1] 操作方法[/h1]
マニュアルらしきものが見当たりませんので簡単に説明をしておきます。ただし、詳細がわからない点がありますのでご了承ください。

・自機の移動
カーソルキー
前述の通り、「↑」で上昇・「↓」で下降と、「↓」で上昇・「↑」で下降が選択できます。

・照準
　マウス

・機銃
機銃はマウスで照準をあわせ、左クリックすると発射します。機体方向に関係なく重力や慣性を無視して真っ直ぐ飛んでいくので、見越し射撃は必要ありません。未来のスーパーテクノロジーです。打ちっ放しにしていると、温度が上昇してオーバーヒートを起し、しばらく撃てなくなりますので無駄弾は禁物。

・ミサイル
敵機に照準をあわせ右クリックすると発射されます。もちろん自動追尾です。威力は高いのですが、とにかく速度が遅く敵機に振り切られてしまうことも。耐久度の高い艦船やボス向けでしょう。

・詳細不明（機体が加速する？)
2ボタンマウスならホイールクリック。何が起きているのかわかりません。

・ミサイルの補充
「b」キーを押すと若干スコアが減点され、ミサイルが補充できます。上限は機体ごとに決められた本数（ゲーム開始時の初期値）で、補充できる本数の上限はよくわかりません。

[h1] パワーアップ要素[/h1]
時々、メッセージが表示され自動的に自機がパワーアップします。条件はよくわかりません。パワーアップの種類はいくつかあり、それなりに役に立ちます。効果はその場であらわれ、一定時間続きます。ありがたいのは残機追加とダメージ全快。

[h1] まとめ[/h1]
キー設定などの問題を除けば、ゲームとしては、そこまで酷評されるものではないと思います。

でも、ボスのデザインはどうにかならなかったのだろうか……
近未来の設定だと思うんだけど、場違い感が凄いなぁ……
特に1面のあれは何？どこかで見たような気がするんだけど、特徴はそれっぽし、でもよく見ると全然似ていないし、そもそもこの時代にあれはないだろうよ……

author: {'steamid': '76561198036539708', 'num_games_owned': 1417, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1439081315}
review:
I'm going to start this off by stating that I'm aware I have .1 hrs played on record, that's about all the time it took to tell this was a massive turd. I got this in a bundle that I paid a dollar for and I overpaid for this by a large margin.  If you have a problem with the amount of time I played this game, good for you, pat yourself on the back but don't bother to comment telling me I haven't played much of the game because .1 hr was too much time to waste.

Pros:
- Quit function works.
- Uninstall also works.

Cons:
- Absolutely everything pertaining to this game.

It's clearly either a mobile port or something because the actual amount of in game help is nil, there are no control settings or graphics settings.  You might look at the screenshots on this store page and think "Well the game doesn't look half bad for a game from 2011", and if they hadn't been massively touched up in an editing program I'd agree with you, but the screenshots are a lie.

The genre is rail shooter so if you're thinking it's like Afterburner, Space Harrier, Time Crisis, Area 51, you are giving this game too much credit, it's nothing like those games aside from the genre type.  In this game you are often going to be hit with weapons fire that you can't see because your craft takes up about 40% of the screen, enemies are almost indistinguishable from scenery, and you have almost zero control over your craft or it's position on screen.  You can use a boost with the middle mouse click, but there's little to no point in using it unless you feel like ramming enemy planes.  Also your missles are almost a waste of time, you can lock on to enemies but you'll be lucky if they hit.

Sounds aren't terrible for a game of this type, but I didn't bother to list this as a pro because decent sound isn't going to save this game.

I strongly suggest you keep skip this one regardless of whatever price it might go down to.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969957382', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1438236263}
review:
Hyper Fighters is a game that was recently the subject of a free giveaway, and with good reason (that reason being nobody should pay a cent for this, let alone the $10 they're asking for). Gameplay is incredibly repetitive -- start a level, shoot down a bunch of fighter jets, even more fighter jets come by but your gun is in cooldown so you soak a bunch of damage, you soak a bunch more damage from a turret you saw for two seconds that scrolled offscreen but it can still shoot at you for a few moments afterward, then boss fight. 

The boss fights are repetitive too -- you simply fly in circles around it, taking potshots or loosing your last missiles upon it, until finally you wear down its health meter. Bosses are covered with numerous turrets which you have to constantly dodge the fire from, and have so much HP that you'll only have taken out one or two by the time the boss is killed.

I think the weakest aspect of this title is the fact that, for an on-rails shooter, you're required to maneuver about. Since you are on rails, there's not actually much room to maneuver about, so getting shredded by enemy fire is almost inevitable. This culminated in a boss fight where my plane actually collided with the boss, resulting in me dying instantly. And then it happened two more times. 

There were a few more janky issues with the game. After running out of rockets, a message saying "Buy more rockets" appears next to the ammo counter. I could find no way to purchase more rockets in-mission, and my stockpile was replenished at the start of the next mission -- or, on occasion, from a random power-up. And I do mean random; after every enemy wave or so, I was awarded one power-up, like a temporary laser sight, an instant reduction in my cannon's cooldown, temporary invulnerability, and a few more I can't bother to remember right now. They would have been more useful if there was some choice involved (like choosing healing after a difficult wave, or never ever choosing laser sight because it's completely useless).

I do have something positive to say about this game -- it uses lens flares to mark your health meter, the boss's health meter, and your cannon's cooldown meter. Lens flares are pretty cool. Also, there was a really cool giant octopus in one level. Octopi are really cool.

All in all, though, this is a game you should probably avoid. It doesn't even have cards! Hyper Fighters...more like LAZY Fighters!

review:
Prababka zawsze powtarzała „wnusiu, wkładaj zimą ciepłe majtki i nigdy, nigdy nie graj w gry Team 6”.
Nie posłuchałem i zagrałem w cudo o nazwie „Hyper fighters”. Widzę myśliwce i myślę” „Nooo nie może być tak źle, nawet jak na strzelankę” teraz napisałem recenzyjkę czekając aż mnie zabiorą do szpitala dla nerwowo chorych. Jest źle i to srogo źle.
Ta gra to klon Space Invaders i celowniczków, można tylko unikać ognia innych maszyn i cały czas należy wcisnięty mieć lewy przycisk myszy. Ot cała filozofia gry. Grafika to jakiś ponury żart, została nie zrobiona, ale wys...na raczej. 
Dźwięki w tej grze przypominają raczej odgłosy wykonywane przez brzuch podczas zjedzenia dużej ilości meksykańskiego żarcia. Grałem w to niecałe 10 minut i mam serdecznie dość. Nie wiem co napisać więcej, wkurzony jestem, że takie gry są wydawane i jeszcze ktoś za nie chce niemałą kasę. 
Jest dużo lepszych gier tego typu na stronach z grami freeware i tam raczej polecam wam skierować kroki. Gry od Team 6 były ostro zjechane przez znanych youtuberów NRGeeka i Bartka GM, gdzie ostrzegali aby w to nie grać. Nie posłuchałem i mam za swoje.

Serio, nie ruszać nawet kijem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143880021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1437941208}
review:
Al principio le iba a poner una calificación negativa, pero decidí darle una segunda oportunidad y me gustó.  7/10

Pro:
-El juego en si no es muy complicado, y pasarlo es relativamente fácil si le agarras el truco
-Puedes salir de la rutina con este juego, pasártelo y sentir que jugaste algo diferente
-El modo historia parece hacer referencia a guerras reales, como vietnam, aunque no lo dicen directamente, pero si has leído o sabes historia, te darás cuenta de la similitud (lo cual, es un detalle que agradezco)
-Bombas semi-infinitas, se compran con puntos, los cuales obtienes destruyendo.
-Los controles responden bien, algo que pensé que no lo haría, pero tener que usar las flechas... (abajo me quejo)
-No se ralentiza casi nada aun con muchas entidades y explosiones (solo sentí ralentizado 1 vez, y duro menos de 1seg y mi pc no es que sea muy buena)

Meh:
-Es un juego bastante corto, Con 1 hora y media o menos te lo pasas, solo son 14 stage.
-El juego es bastante repetitivo, aparece un avión, disparas, aparece otro, disparas, aparece un submarino o barco, disparas... pero si te pones a pensar en otro tipo de juegos, tipo, fps, es lo mismo, aparece un enemigo, disparas, aparece otro, disparas... así que, para gusto los colores.
-La musica al principio es buena, de hecho esta bien ambientada, pero son las mismas 3 o 4 canciones para todo.
-Las cinemáticas están mal hechas, muchas veces al derrotar al jefe, la cinemática apuntara al vació y quizá el ala del avión... wtf?
-No destaca en el apartado gráfico, pero al menos no es poligonal, algunas texturas se ven estiradas de mas, pero en general yo le daría un 7/10

Contra:
-Devuélveme mi puto ASDW!
-Usar las flechas y tener que presionar "B" para recargar las bombas es, completamete horrible, ¿saben cuanta distancia hay entre las flechas y la B? Necesitas quitar la mano y presionar B repetidas veces para recargar y la mayoría de las veces, bajará tu vida por hacer eso. 
-Carece completamente de alguna explicación de jugabilidad, como la vieja escuela "descúbrelo tu mismo" (al menos antes podíamos leer el libro/manual que venia en el juego, pero esto es digital :s)
-Carece de configuración, no te deja configurar los botones y en ningún lugar te muestra los botones disponibles, así como configuración de gráficos/pantalla.
-En juego en ningún lugar te explica como obtener vida extra y durante la partida vi que me dieron vidas extras por 2 formas (creo) Obteniendo puntos (a saber cuantos) y pasando de nivel (no siempre, pero al menos la mitad de las veces, si) y por alguna razón que desconozco, a veces comienza a disparar solo lo cual viene bien por que no se gasta tu munición, pero la mayoría de las veces lo hace cuando no tienes a nadie que dispararle (me gustaría saber como activar eso cuando yo quiera, pero como he dicho antes, carece de cualquier explicación el juego)
-Carece de personalizaron de aviones, una buena forma para hacer rejugable un juego es hacerlo desbloqueable, este juego carece de ello, al menos eso creo, pues al principio estoy seguro que solo tenia 2 aviones (no lo recuerdo bien) y al final tenía uno que no había visto, pero estoy seguro que ya lo tenía por que el avión es feo (no es mejor que los otros 2)

En conclusión, si te regalan este juego, dale la oportunidad, y si lo vas a comprar, espera a que este en 90% de descuento como mínimo, no vale la pena pagar el precio real ni menos de 90%

-. There is no way to change control mapping ... wtf again !?
-. The only option is adjuts or reduce sound / music and invert controller.
-. Bad port from Wii. Just copy paste with a little changing for PC port.

Controller are fix with mouse for aim, arrow key for move ... but R key to dodge.  How can I push the R key if move with arrow key. If we can used WSAD, its become playable but its not.  Well, this is the most horrible game in my library and a bad PC Port ever.

So, is the worst game that I'd ever play. I can't recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997417745', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1437780684}
review:
С чего бы начать.
Итак. Так как игру я лично получил бесплатно на раздаче, то моя оценка возможно будет немного мягче чем у тех кто её купил. Но я постараюсь быть максимально объективным.

Учитывая подавляющее большинство негативных обзоров на игру, я осознанно делаю его положительным. И объясню почему.

1) ~ - Сюжета тут нет, так что для кого то это будет минусом. Однако есть не мало игр где он и не нужен. По этому этот минус сомнителен.
2) - Музыка и звуковое сопровождение. Музыка местами не плоха, но приедается как и спец эффекты, которые хочется убрать уже на третьем уровне. В этом плане у игры явно минус.
3) ~ - В плане управления тут есть две стороны. 
Первая будет минусом. Минус в том что нужно управлять самолётом стрелками и мышкой, а не AWSD или джойстиком. И управление в самой игре, увы, нельзя изменить. Кроме инверсия движения мыши. (что в общем то можно поправить прогой по переназначению клавиш). 
Вторая будет нейтральной. Привыкнуть к управлению что есть в игре можно довольно легко и это не сильно скажется на самой игре.
4) - Графика... 
За неё игру ругают пожалуй больше всего. Да, игра 2011 года, но она больше была нацелена на консоль Wii. А как известна Wii не выделялась сверх крутой графикой даже среди своих собратьев PS3 и Xbox360. Что в какой то степени может стать причиной, пусть и не полностью. 
Конечно же главным минусом порта для PC является отсутствие настроек графики, которые тут пожалуй не помешали бы. 
Кроме того. По какой то странной причине, в cfg файле, некоторые настройки и эффекты графики по дефолту выключены, и графика ещё хуже чем должна была быть. Хотя, как это справить я описал тут. >> http://steamcommunity.com/app/267960/discussions/0/541906989396175540/
5) Сама игра. 
Часть спец эффектом мне лично нравятся, особенно взрывы. Большинство боссов на 14 уровнях игры, пожалуй единственная причина дойти до конца. 
Они вполне не плохо сделаны, что тут же портит их пассивность. Только первый и тройка последних боссов будут вести по вам огонь. Другие же боссы будут просто ждать своего уничтожения на любом уровне сложности. Кстати сами уровни сложности тоже мало чем отличаются.
Так что на уровнях реальную угрозу больше представляют рядовые самолёты и корабли.
А уж тот факт что могучих боссов, накопив запас из 6-10 ракет, можно убить за одну!!! секунду... Делает их совсем не интересными.

Вывод: 
Понравилась ли мне игра? 
Да! 
Но... 
Приятное впечатление от неё крайне мимолётно и уходит сразу же по завершению. А потом лишь разочарование. Нет реиграбельности. Много недоработок. Да и терпеливый и опытный игрок пройдёт игру за пару часов. Стоит ли покупать эту игру? Это уже решать вам. Разве что только со скидкой в 90% или получив как подарок. 
Пожалуй только тогда можно насладиться этой неоднозначной игрой пару часов. Ну а потом забыть о ней. И скорее всего навсегда.

review:
- kostenlos bekommen (IndieGala) -

Das Spiel hat vorwiegend negative Reviews erhalten, die ich größtenteils verstehen kann.
Es ist von 2011 und sieht leider für dieses Jahr schlecht aus und aktuell sowieso. 

Man kann das Flugzeug nicht manuell steuern, das heißt das Spiel steuert die allgemeine Richtung und wir können in einem bestimmten Radius, nach unten, oben und zur Seite lenken. Gewöhnungsbedürftig und am Anfang nervig und schlecht umgesetzt. Nach paar Minuten hat man sich gewöhnt und es ist ok, dennoch langweilig, weil man die Gegner regelrecht vor die Nase gehalten bekommt und man eigentlich nur schießen muss - Moorhuhn mäßig. So entsteht keine Herausforderung. 

Der Soundtrack ist ok und findet gute Momente im Spiel.

Dennoch fehlt im Spiel das gewisse Etwas. Wie eine Atmosphäre die durch eine gute Story beigetragen wird. Einigermaßen gute Grafik und ein komplett steuerbares Flugzeug. Das ganze hört sich etwas nach "Tom Clancy's HAWK" an. Das heißt das Game brauch man echt nicht spielen, außer man liebt das Genre, aber selbst dann gibt es bessere Games als dieses.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044115669', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1430786273}
review:
Wow, this is a bad game. I don't even want to put in the effort to give a long review, because I just don't feel it's worth my time.

The graphics are passable. I mean, on-rails shooters don't exactly need the best graphics that Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 56 can offer. They're not bad at all - they're passable enough to get the job done.

Music and sound effects are alright. Nothing exactly stood out to me, but the music did give the game a feel that it was more exciting than it actually was.

Gameplay is horrible. I mean, it's an on-rails shooter, and you can have your own opinions about those, but as far as on-rails shooters go, this game is dreadful. Enemy fire seems very, very accurate and constant, almost like the game is designed to make sure you lose all your lives in one level. You don't have much room to move around to dodge enemy fire, so you'll get hit a lot no matter what. The controls are not explained, and there is [b]NO CONTROLLER SUPPORT[/b], hell, [b]NO WASD SUPPORT EITHER[/b]. I was stuck to use the left mouse button for firing my gun and the arrow keys for movement. The game does not tell you how to fire rockets, so I never figured that one out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048123833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1421468244}
review:
I don't know, honestly.
I like it, because it feels like an arcade.
Wait, it IS an arcade.
People complain about the graphics (which are not exactly top notch, but hey, Doom 2 graphics aren't Crysis-level and that doesn't make it bad), and the fact that it's an on-rails shooter.
Hello? It's a somewhat old game, arcade-style, and ported from the Wii of all consoles. Of course it'll have that.
CoD fanboys also complain about the resolution. Again, it's a Wii game, and the low res doesn't really mean it's bad, else Contra would be bad, wouldn't it?

But other than that, the pros are mainly the sountrack. The music is truly enjoyable. The other feature I like is the aircraft design. Gun aiming and plane movement are separate things, that's also a welcome feature.

The cons are the controls: Mouseaim is fine, but moving with the arrow keys? Seems unconfortable to me, especially since you gotta buy extra rockets with the B key. I'd rather move with WASD. Don't get me wrong, they are not otherwordly, but can be unconfortable and a little annoying to get used to. Next con are the levels. They are not quite bad, but they can be repetitive and a little bland. But then again, it's emulating arcade-type games, so I can let that one pass.

Overall, don't give a single sh1t about what others say, if you like arcade shooters like Afterburner 2, you may like this and should give it a try.
As with Chaos Domain, I suggest you rather get it as a gift, in case you regret it.

TL;DR:
>arcade style plane shooter
>weird controls
>cool ost
>wii port
>not for everyone's taste

10/10 would run out of rockets again

author: {'steamid': '76561198048054765', 'num_games_owned': 3025, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1615143055}
review:
I generally like to wait until I have a handful of hours in a game before I make any sort of recommendations. But sometimes you don't have to bother waiting when there are glaring problems.

This is easily Top 10 one of the laziest ports ever made. You play this with the keyboard and mouse (arrow keys to move, mouse to aim) and no option to change that those key bindings. I don't know about you but when I'm using the mouse for aiming I'm more comfortable using WASD for movement. But here's the really fun part! You have to use the R key to dodge. Just stop and thing about this for one second. Your left hand is on the arrow keys, your right hand is on the mouse, HOW EXACTLY are you supposed to reach that R key?! And to add insult to injury you can't simply just press R to dodge, you need to R+direction in which you wish to dodge.

So! You take your left hand off the arrow keys and move it to the R button and you take your hand off your mouse and move it over to the arrow keys, and presto you can dodge! For something like an on-rail twitch shooter dodging is an essentially core gameplay mechanic. This is broken, the controls in this game are broken.

I kinda want to like this game, I'll probably play it a few more times, but until they patch this up and let you customize your key bindings I can't help to tell you all to stay away from this. I can see why this went for $0.99 during the sale.

Stay! Away!

review:
As an arcade game with some neat hardware gimmick, no expectation of modern graphics (or graphics options, for that matter), and the ability to walk away after putting in a quarter or two, this might just possibly not be completely terrible. Unfortunately, it is.

This game is by Team 6 Studios, who also brought you Glacier 3: The Meltdown, another terrible game that bears many of the same hallmarks as this one. Not only does it not give you the option to change the controls, it doesn't even tell you what they [i]are[/i]. From what I understand both these games are ported from the Wii, where a digital manual is available from the Home screen at any time, but frankly that's no excuse for at the very least making that information available in some form. The game is locked at a very low resolution, and the store screenshots look much nicer than anything you'll ever see in-game.

As far as gameplay, I came hoping for Star Fox, but got nothing of the sort. Bland enemies, [i]awful[/i] flight physics, uninteresting levels, and the requirement to both move the plane and aim the gun (which I imagine was originally designed to work with the Wii's pointer functionality) just doesn't do the game any favors. There's no controller support in this bare-as-bare-bones-ports-get game, but because of the pointer thing even when I mapped what buttons I knew about (and I think I'm missing something because the game mentions buying bombs on the mission score screen) through Xpadder, using an analog stick to emulate mouse movement has never been a good idea. Playing a Star Fox-like game on PC with a controller would have made me very happy, but unfortunately, this was not that game.

review:
Well, this without any doubt is one of the worst games in my steam library. I got it as a part of a dirt-cheap bundle, so I don't really complain about wasted money, but this game is just ridiculous. 
When I saw the screenshots my first thoughts were "Well, it looks like a nice little flying arcade", then I noticed the "rail shooter" part, but even this piece of news didn't discourage me... But then I tried to play it.
Terrible graphics are one thing, I am tolerant to all that stuff, but when the resolution is fixed at 800x600, so you can't play without your eyes starting to bleed is just beyond good and evil. The design of levels is "Hey, Ma, look, I'm using 3DsMAX!"-tier, however boss models and designs are not half bad, I have to admit. Basically it's the only good thing in entire game: it has no plot, no good gameplay as it's hard to dodge all of enemy projectiles, however bosses are too easy, so even the simplest balance is absent too. All the levels can be beaten in a couple of hours and the only thing that can drive you to play more is beating high scores. But why would anyone want to beat one's score in this piece of shit? It's just what people call 'lazy' in any way possible. I see no point of this being ported from WII.
Seriously, don't buy it. Don't. Even if you are an idiot who collects games and never plays them: don't buy it. Even if you are going to get it for free. Never.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050374501', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1403499766}
review:
Blecch. I just played it again to be reminded why I didn't like it so here's my breakdown so you don't make the same mistake and try it twice like I did.

This game is supposed to be a nod to Afterburner, the massive arcade hit. In this game, you are in a plane of some sort - I don't know, I didn't pay attention to the story. This plane is extremely special in that it has nothing you would expect a modern plane to have. There is no radar, no speed control, and the control scheme is laughable. It REQUIRES you to use the mouse to aim and the arrow keys to move. Left click shoots, right click locks rockets and fires. Minimal voiceover, typos in the text, etc... One of the most unique features in the game is the magical water. I call it magical because somehow you can see the propellor on any boat you fly over but cannot see submarines until they surface to launch missiles at you. This brings me back to the radar, there isn't any. This means that there is no warning if a rocket is about to hit your ship. It just slams into you. If you're looking for a game to play with a younger child, this one might be good. Nothing looks real and they can "fly" the ship while you shoot. MAYBE that would make it enjoyable. Otherwise, leave it in the street and hope some asshole finds it first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025212022', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1400746910}
review:
This is a classic example of how not to make a game. If you want to make games, buy this in a bundle or something as an example of everything you shouldn't do. 

It took me 1 hour to finish all 14 levels of railshooting intensity on easy because I'm not going to waste my time on a bad game. I even left the game running during a boss sequence--I only died once while inactive for a good 5 minutes--to look up the unrebindable mystery controls since they are never told to you in the menus or the game. LMB = fire the constantly overheating gun, RMB = hold/release to lock-on/fire the unreliable missiles, MMB = Hyper Speed (TM), ARROW KEYS TO MOVE, AND B OF ALL KEYS to refill missiles at the cost of score, which doesn't matter. Basically what you do is hold down MMB for the entire game to rush to the boss fights where you spam all your missiles and shoot it for a few seconds. You only get 12 missiles on a boss fight but they usually take out 1/2 to 3/4 of its HP (to be fair, easy difficulty). You gain random powerups of unknown duration for no apparent reason throughout the level, and I think you get lives by having large combo kills; all the more reason to just hold MMB the entire time.

Those photos must be doctored because the game doesn't look like that. It is god awfully ugly and there is no way to change that. Enemies are bland and blend with the environment, making them difficult to see. Trying to bring up the steam overlay freezes the game and takes about a minute. Triggering the overlay sometimes pauses the game, when it feels like it. Also your aircraft takes up a good 1/3 of the screen and the game is never clear how far you can move with the arrow keys. Whenever you try to move the plane, the cursor for your weapon moves as well, which screws up your targeting. The targeting reticule turns into a circle the instant you hover over an enemy so you don’t really know if you’re hitting it or not. The bosses look cool, but the fight sequences perform the same camera loops for every boss intro and fight, which leads to some awkward camera angles; also their deaths look pathetic. Additionally, you don't have to kill everything on the boss for it to die, which doesn't make sense to me. Two levels don't even have a boss and just end abruptly. 

The only other good thing I can say about this game is the 3 or so metal tracks are nice in a cheesy sense, but are repeated on some levels. The voice acting is atrocious, if you can hear it, and so is the writing. Not that I was expecting much from a rail shooter but at least spell and grammar check FFS.

Don't get this. $10 is a blatant rip off. I'd barely pay $1 for this near alpha level trash.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995594353', 'num_games_owned': 6862, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1399736857}
review:
Stay away from this game, even if it is in a bundle or it is free. To be honest I couldn't play more than two missions - at the end of the second one I had to kill some bomber with a submarine aspect...
Graphics - worst I've seen in years. I couldn't tell if I flew over water or plain or dessert. A mix of grey, green and blue on the ground could be anything. Textures and resolution are so low that the game looks like it was made for PS1.
Story - zero. Really, zero. You don't know why you fight, who are you, who are the enemies... hell, you don't even know if you're on Earth or not.
Gameplay - I played rail shooters before, but this is bad, bad, bad. The attack pattern of your plane is that of a zombie snail, probably. Your plane is huge on the screen and blocks your view. Some so-called power-ups (laser sight, auto-fire) activate by themselves: you don't pick them up or charge them, just a text pop on screen and voila, you have it for 5-8 seconds. Probably at the worst time. Not that those are any good - your plane don't shoot where your cursor is when you want to shoot at the edge of screen and... 
Just don't buy it. And if you did, don't install it.
